column1: The provider uses a real-time x-ray (fluoroscopy) to see where to place the needle in the joint.
Hip injection is done to reduce hip pain caused by problems in the bones or cartilage of your hip.

The hip pain is often caused by: - Bursitis - Arthritis - Injury to the hip joint or surrounding area - Overuse or strain from running or other activities A hip injection can also help diagnose hip pain.
Risks are rare, but may include: - Bruising - Swelling - Skin irritation - Allergic reaction to medicine - Infection - Bleeding in the joint - Weakness in the leg
